alert.note: Alert for Eastern Glacier; Eastern Pondera; Liberty; Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Toole (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 2:04PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Moderate to heavy snow showers will impact portions of northeastern Pondera, Liberty, Glacier and Toole Counties through 300 PM MST... At 201 PM MST, satellite and webcams were tracking heavy snow showers along a line extending from 31 miles north of Joplin to 36 miles north of North Browning. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Brief period of moderate to heavy snow and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Satellite and webcams. IMPACT...Visibility down to a quarter mile or less could result in hazardous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Shelby, Cut Bank, Chester, Browning, Sunburst, Kevin, Lothair, Joplin, East Glacier Park Village, North Browning, Kiowa, South Browning, East Glacier Park, Sweet Grass, Babb, Oilmont, Logan Pass, Santa Rita, Ferdig and Saint Mary. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 353 and 397. Highway 2 between mile markers 209 and 332. Highway 89 between mile markers 1 and 49, and between mile markers 93 and 110. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If traveling, be prepared for sudden changes in visibility and road conditions.
